param.name: alignments
param.label: Alignment file
param.help: The input alignment file(s) where the gene expression has to be counted. The file can have a SAM or BAM format; but ALL files in the series must be in THE SAME format.

param.name: source_select
param.label: GFF/GTF Source
param.option: Use a built-in index (which fits your reference)
Use a built-in index (entire list) - avoid this option if possible; only useful if you design a workflow
Use a built-in index based on the 'metadata.dbkey' attribute; ideal in workflows

param.name: reference_gene_sets
param.label: Reference Gene Sets used during alignment (GFF/GTF)

validator.message: No indexes are available for the selected input dataset

param.name: reference_gene_sets
param.label: Gene annotation file
param.help: The program assumes that the provided annotation file is in GTF format. Make sure that the gene annotation file corresponds to the same reference genome as used for the alignment.

param.name: reference_gene_sets
param.label: Reference Gene Sets used during alignment (GFF/GTF)

validator.message: No indexes are available for the selected input dataset

param.name: format
param.label: Output format
param.option: BED format (line per exon): chr "\t" start "\t" stop "\t" description "\t" readcount

param.name: gff_feature_type
param.label: GFF feature type filter
param.help: Specify the feature type. Only rows which have the matched matched feature type in the provided GTF annotation file will be included for read counting. `exon' by default.

param.name: gff_feature_attribute
param.label: GFF gene identifier
param.help: Specify the attribute type used to group features (eg. exons) into meta-features (eg. genes), when GTF annotation is provided. `gene_id' by default. This attribute type is usually the gene identifier. This argument is useful for the meta-feature level summarization.

param.name: contribute_to_multiple_features
param.label: Allow read to contribute to multiple features
param.help: If specified, reads (or fragments if -p is specified) will be allowed to be assigned to more than one matched meta- feature (or matched feature if -f is specified)

param.name: protocol
param.label: Strand specific protocol
param.help: Indicate if strand-specific read counting should be performed.

param.name: multimapping_counts
param.label: Count multi-mapping reads/fragments
param.help: If specified, multi-mapping reads/fragments will be counted (ie. a multi-mapping read will be counted up to N times if it has N reported mapping locations). The program uses the `NH' tag to find multi-mapping reads.

param.name: mapping_quality
param.label: Minimum read quality
param.help: The minimum mapping quality score a read must satisfy in order to be counted. For paired-end reads, at least one end should satisfy this criteria. 12 by default.

param.name: fragment_counting
param.label: PE: Count fragments instead of reads
param.help: Paired-end specific: If specified, fragments (or templates) will be counted instead of reads.

param.name: check_distance
param.label: PE: Check paired-end distance
param.help: Paired-end specific: If specified, paired-end distance will be checked when assigning fragments to meta-features or features. This option is only applicable when -p (Count fragments instead of reads) is specified. The distance thresholds should be specified using -d and -D (minimum and maximum fragment/template length) options.

param.name: only_both_ends
param.label: PE: only allow fragments with both reads aligned
param.help: Paired-end specific: If specified, only fragments that have both ends successfully aligned will be considered for summarization. This option is only applicable for paired-end reads.

param.name: exclude_chimerics
param.label: PE: Exclude chimeric fragments
param.help: Paired-end specific: If specified, the chimeric fragments (those fragments that have their two ends aligned to different chromosomes) will NOT be included for summarization. This option is only applicable for paired-end read data.

param.name: summarization_level
param.label: On feature level
param.help: If specified, read summarization will be performed at the feature level. By default (-f is not specified), the read summarization is performed at the meta-feature level.

data.name: output_summary
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${', '.join([ str(a.hid)+': '+a.name for a in $alignments ])} summary

tool.help:
featureCounts #############
Overview -------- FeatureCounts is a light-weight read counting program written entirely in the C programming language. It can be used to count both gDNA-seq and RNA-seq reads for genomic features in in SAM/BAM files. It has a variety of advanced parameters but its major strength is its outstanding performance: analysis of a 10GB SE BAM file takes about 7 minutes on a single average CPU (Homo Sapiens genome) [1].
Input formats ------------- Alignments should be provided in either:
- SAM format, http://samtools.sourceforge.net/samtools.shtml#5 - BAM format
Gene regions should be provided in the GFF/GTF format:
- http://genome.ucsc.edu/FAQ/FAQformat.html#format3 - http://www.ensembl.org/info/website/upload/gff.html
Installation ------------
1. Make sure you have proper GFF/GTF files (corresponding to your reference genome used for the aligment) uploaded to your history.
2. Make sure that your gene_sets.loc is configured properly as data table. This is generally done by copying the right information into: tool_data_table_conf.xml. More info at: https://wiki.galaxyproject.org/Admin/Tools/Data%20Tables
